chapter.title: Managing Entitlement Methods
chapter.para: There are two methods for managing your subscriptions and entitlements. Both management methods access &scc; and provide specialized benefits. Directly connecting to &scc; is the recommended default way of managing your &susemgr; Server. If you have special network security requirements which do not allow access from your internal network the internet then you may use a &sle; 12 SP1 Server running the Subscription Management Tool (SMT) for maintaining your entitlements. This tool will contact &scc; and obtain updates for your clients which you may then mount on your &susemgr; Server for providing updates. This is the preferred method for managing client systems within a highly secure network infrastructure.

sect1.title: Overview SUSE Customer Center (SCC)
sect1.para: SUSE Customer Center (SCC) is the central place to manage your purchased SUSE subscriptions and entitlements, helping you access your update channels and get in contact with SUSE experts. The user-friendly interface gives you a centralized view of all your SUSE subscriptions, allowing you to easily find all subscription information you need. The improved registration provides faster access to your patches and updates. SUSE Customer Center is also designed to provide a common platform for your support requests and feedback.
